title: Road-rage fight in the middle of a busy A-road in Bristol sees two men brawl in front of onlookers
text:
Two men who became involved in a road-side brawl in Bristol had to be pulled apart by a member of the public in the middle of busy traffic.

Other motorists watched on in horror as one of them had his top almost ripped off during the showdown, which was filmed by motorist Michelle May yesterday.

A third man then got out of his car and waded in, managing to split them up and diffuse the situation.

The two men (pictured centre) both got out of their vehicles and began brawling in the middle of the road in Bristol

The footage begins with the two locked in a heated discussion before they launch at each other between the cars waiting in traffic.

At one point one of the men almost rips off the t-shirt and jumper from the other man as he grabs at his back.

After around 30 seconds of conflict, a third man walks towards the pair to break them up, putting his hand out to warn he is approaching.

After around 30 seconds of conflict, a third man gets out of his car and breaks up the fight by pushing one of the men away (pictured)

At one point one of the men almost rips off the t-shirt and jumper from the other man as he grabs at his back

He successfully resolves the situation, pushing one man back as the other walks away.

The two men, clearly still angry, return to their cars while continuing to shout abuse at each other.

The fight, which was filmed from a nearby car, held up two lanes of traffic that had been waiting at a set of lights.

Mrs May said: 'Only in Bristol. Fair play to the guy though for splitting them up.'

The pair eventually got back into their respective vehicles - but the Audi driver then cuts in front of the van.

Avon and Somerset Police said that they did not receive any calls about the incident.
